sentences.english: Blair: Well, lucky for you, your friend is someone I actually care about.
sentences.chinese: 算你走运，你的那位朋友碰巧是我挺在乎的一个人。

sentences.english: But if I see it happen once, I'm never going back.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果我碰巧看到一次，我就再也回不了家了。

sentences.english: And when a committed Lock Person lives in the same building as a No Lock Person, things can heat up.
sentences.chinese: 当这两种人碰巧住一栋楼里，事情就大条了。

sentences.english: I say it is just a con-incidence that you two have a couple look.
sentences.chinese: 我说，你们只是碰巧有着那夫妻相罢了。

sentences.english: British journalist who happened to see the images this morning was appalled.
sentences.chinese: 一位英国记者碰巧看到这幅广告，惊得目瞪口呆。

sentences.english: If you happen to be most night a home, don't just shut and not locked.
sentences.chinese: 你碰巧是最晚一个回家，别只关门而不上锁。

sentences.english: And if the planet happens to be saved on the way, that is all to the good.
sentences.chinese: 如果在此过程中碰巧拯救了地球，那是再好不过了。

sentences.english: He defended himself, saying the cops just happened to be in the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 他为自己进行辩护，说交警们只是碰巧在那里。

sentences.english: The small tin soldier happened to find a small hole in one side of the box.
sentences.chinese: 小锡士兵碰巧在盒子的一边发现一个小孔。

sentences.english: Well it happens to give me three threes in a row.
sentences.chinese: 碰巧给我了个一列三个3的结果。
小左只是碰巧持有这灵魂。

sentences.english: I happened on just the thing I'd been looking for.
sentences.chinese: 我碰巧找到了一直在找的东西。

sentences.english: The next day will be my birthday.
sentences.chinese: 碰巧，泓泓也是农历今天生日。

sentences.english: I happed on her in the street yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我碰巧在街上遇见了她。

sentences.english: I chanced to be thinking of the same thing.
Well, I just don't happen to have an oven-like pressure vessel I can heat.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，我只是碰巧没有用来加热的压力锅。

definition: just by chance/to happen to (just at the right time)/opportune
too bad/unfortunately/as luck would have it
as it turns out/by lucky coincidence/(of number, time, size etc) just right
to run into/to meet (unexpectedly)/to bump into
just (in time)/just right/just enough/to happen to/to chance to/by chance/it just so happens that
